content:
How does this got approved? There is literally nothing in the goal or description mentioning overnight travel and how to solve it. To make matters worse Test/Validator 4 checks the late version of night travel which will succeed even if you don't consider this as an option. It literally means that 40% of the test cases has not been covered by the description or just systematically doesn't matter.

It's not the test cases that have names so at least the players would have a little help regarding that. This problem needed a lot of work before it should have gotten approved.
The statement is clear. The input and output are simple, but there is a challenge in all the three clash modes. Good job!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's fine, all requirements are met, fits to all clash modes.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I think it is good
Question, have you considered a test case where you arrive before midnight but the arrival time is after midnight? If you reply to me I'd be glad to approve the submission.

Warning : At first, I just check for shortest game mode, but after a suggestion, I enable all game modes for this contribution. I wait another day of comments before passing it from WIP to submission !

When I first read "It is NOW and we must arrive at ARRIVAL", I took ARRIVAL to be a location, and was thoroughly confused until I saw the inputs.

Suggestion: "It is NOW (time) and we must arrive at ARRIVAL (time)"

Edit: OK, it's (currently) reverse only, so it doesn't matter :)
This would be great for both shortest and fastest too, don't limit it to reverse imo

I'm confused, I want to create a "without statement" game but the form to submit contains required fields. 
Is it only for the validation process ?
With reverse, feel free to put whatever in there

I like shortest puzzle game mode, even if it's so rare to have it in battle of code. That's why my first contribution is of this type. But.. you are right, why not checking all game modes if it's compatible : it's done !

It was my first contribution and I've got much too learn !

At first, the problem was create for "without instructions" mode only so it's why the test case are not named. It was a fault to not rename them after changing the game mode. 

I also could have mention a little "Be cautious to handle night travel too" inside the instructions but what can I do more ? I mean you say "how to solve it" but I see nothing particular to add for this ?

Can you explain how to improve validator 4 to handle the night travel late correctly ?
